title: The ONLY Garden Planting Schedule Youll EVER Need

tasks.task: Create a garden planting schedule for a specific zone (Zone 8 in this case).
subtasks: Research the most popular 35 vegetables.
Determine frost dates for each month in the zone.
Organize the vegetables into four categories: start seeds indoors, transplant outdoors, direct sow, and harvest.
Include average harvesting days for each vegetable.
Create a visual representation of the 12 months, including non-growing periods.
Indicate the months when various vegetables can be planted based on frost dates.
Color-code the planting schedule with red (start seeds indoors), yellow (transplant outdoors), and green (direct sow and harvest).
Provide estimated harvesting times for each vegetable based on seed package recommendations.

tasks.task: Use the schedule as a planning tool for the gardening season.
subtasks: Identify optimal times for starting seeds indoors.
Plan outdoor transplanting after the last frost.
Schedule direct sowing before the last frost.
Track when vegetables are ready to harvest based on the estimated days.
